description.raw:
The `_PKGCONFIG_*` variables are not being correctly exported in the cmake config file. This causes the following cmake warning in downstream packages (ign-physics in this case):

~~~
CMake Warning (dev) at /usr/share/cmake/ignition-cmake2/cmake2/IgnUtils.cmake:378 (message):
   -- THIS MESSAGE IS INTENDED FOR IGNITION-PHYSICS AUTHORS --
      (IF YOU SEE THIS, PLEASE REPORT IT)

  Could not find pkg-config information for sdformat8.  It was not provided
  by the find-module for the package, nor was it explicitly passed into the
  call to ign_find_package(~).  This is most likely an error in this
  project's use of ign-cmake.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  CMakeLists.txt:59 (ign_find_package)
This warning is for project developers.  Use -Wno-dev to suppress it.
~~~

This can be worked around in the downstream packages, but this should fix it in a cleaner way. This bug is causing the ignition-sensors3 homebrew bottle build to fail, so I've bumped the version to 8.6.0~pre1 and will make a prerelease.

title.raw: Set `sdformat8_PKGCONFIG_*` variables in cmake config instead of `SDFormat_PKGCONFIG*`
